content:
• Monday, March 26, 2012
  • MAPP

    MAP Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MAPP) says the FDA has issued a Complete Response letter to its New...

    MAP Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MAPP) says the FDA has issued a Complete Response letter to its New Drug Application for Levadex. The FDA didn't cite clinical safety or efficacy issues, nor request any additional clinical studies be conducted prior to approval. It did however, request the company address issues relating to chemistry, manufacturing and controls and observations from a recent facility inspection of a third party manufacturer. Shares +7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • DG

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG) -2.2% AH after announcing unnamed insiders will be selling 25M shares...

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG) -2.2% AH after announcing unnamed insiders will be selling 25M shares (7.4% of all shares currently outstanding) in a secondary offering. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBND

    More on Multiband (NASDAQ:MBND): Q4 results come in line on a per share basis, but beat on...

    More on Multiband (NASDAQ:MBND): Q4 results come in line on a per share basis, but beat on revenue. Profit rose to a record $300M, up 13% Y/Y. The company also raises guidance for 2012, now expecting revenue of about $320M, ahead of the Street view of $295M. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • HTS

    Hatteras Financial (NYSE:HTS) -2.6% AH after announcing a 15M share stock offering, good for...

    Hatteras Financial (NYSE:HTS) -2.6% AH after announcing a 15M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $421M based on today's close. Hatteras intends to use the proceeds to buy mortgage-backed securities. It also plans to "borrow against the agency securities through repurchase agreements and use the proceeds of the borrowings to acquire additional agency securities."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOL

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ2 beats on all fronts. Overall revenue dipped 7.5% Y/Y,...

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ2 beats on all fronts. Overall revenue dipped 7.5% Y/Y, primarily due to lower enrollment at the University of Phoenix, which was partially offset by selective tuition pricing and other fee changes. For the quarter, University of Phoenix degreed enrollment dropped 12.2% to 355,800. Shares +4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • OCLR

    Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) is acquiring rival optical component vendor Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) in an...

    Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) is acquiring rival optical component vendor Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) in an all-stock deal that values Opnext at $1.96/share, or $177M, based on today's close. Oclaro will be issuing 0.42 shares of its stock for every Opnext share outstanding. Many have speculated the optical component market is ripe for consolidation. OCLR +2.2% AH. OPXT halted. FNSR +0.9%. NPTN and JDSU could also see volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (ENOC +2.9%) shares jumped after rival Comverge (COMV -5.3%) cut a $49M deal to go...

    EnerNOC (ENOC +2.9%) shares jumped after rival Comverge (COMV -5.3%) cut a $49M deal to go private and gather much-needed capital, but Wedbush cautions against any deal excitement, warning the buyout suggests ENOC would command just $2.98/share. ENOC has its own credit issues, the firm adds, attributing share gains to short covering on a sale it sees as "pretty unlikely."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • NBIX

    Neurocrine Biosciences (NASDAQ:NBIX) -2.8% AH after announcing a Phase II study for its...

    Neurocrine Biosciences (NASDAQ:NBIX) -2.8% AH after announcing a Phase II study for its NBI-98854 drug for treating tardive dyskinesia failed to meet its primary endpoint, when a site featuring "inconsistent and incorrect application" of its assessment protocol was included. Without the site in question, the study showed a significant reduction in TD symptoms.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • MBND

    Multiband (NASDAQ:MBND): Q4 EPS of $0.06 in-line. Revenue of $77.6M (+9.9% Y/Y). Shares +4.5%...

    Multiband (NASDAQ:MBND): Q4 EPS of $0.06 in-line. Revenue of $77.6M (+9.9% Y/Y). Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $970M (+% Y/Y) beats by...

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $970M (+% Y/Y) beats by $38M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +4.5%) surges following a report from Sina Tech that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) plans to...

    Baidu (BIDU +4.5%) surges following a report from Sina Tech that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) plans to add Baidu as a search option for Chinese users in a pending iOS update, though Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) will remain the default choice. Given Baidu's dominant share of Chinese search, such a move seems like a no-brainer. The report comes shortly after a much-discussed Tim Cook visit to China. (more on Baidu: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • MS

    As talk continues on how quickly Morgan Stanley (MS +4%) might add to its 51% stake in Smith...

    As talk continues on how quickly Morgan Stanley (MS +4%) might add to its 51% stake in Smith Barney, Deutsche Bank estimates Citigroup’s (C +0.8%) 49% holding is worth $9B-$11B. Depending on whether MS buys another 14% stake this year or gets Fed clearance to buy all of it, an increase would boost MS earnings an estimated 4%-12%, based on DB’s 2013 EPS estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.7%) founder and chairman Robert Stiller sold $66.3M of his stock...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.7%) founder and chairman Robert Stiller sold $66.3M of his stock before it plunged on news that Starbucks had developed a single-cup coffee machine to rivals its K-Cup brewer. Stiller’s combined sales on Feb. 15 and 24 were his largest in a single month since at least 2003: Good timing or trading on inside information?
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 5 Comments
  • WCG

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG +5.3%) says a $137.5M deal to settle a whistleblower suit has become...

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG +5.3%) says a $137.5M deal to settle a whistleblower suit has become effective, resolving investigations by the U.S. Justice Department and the states of Florida and Connecticut. WCG says the settlement payout will not materially affect its 2012 financial results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • AXP

    American Express (AXP +2.2%) confirms a new repurchase program of 150M shares worth of its...

    American Express (AXP +2.2%) confirms a new repurchase program of 150M shares worth of its common stock and says it will raise its dividend payout by 11% to $0.20 per share. AXP now trades with a 1.23% yield.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • AAPL

    No sooner are the pixels posted on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) rare underperformance in today's...

    No sooner are the pixels posted on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) rare underperformance in today's session then the stock jumps 1.5% in minutes, apparently as the path has been cleared for the new iPad to soon makes its retail debut in China. Shares now +1.6%, inline with the Nasdaq.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI -1.7%) shares continue their recent slide as Wells Fargo lowers its rating to...

    Baker Hughes (BHI -1.7%) shares continue their recent slide as Wells Fargo lowers its rating to Market Perform and cuts its target price range to $52-54 from $74-76, citing “expectations for a longer wait for the [fracking] market to re-tighten." Last week, BHI warned Q1 profit and operating margin would be lower than forecast due to a lack of demand for fracking machinery.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM +2.6%) outperforms after Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum predicts selling prices...

    Qualcomm (QCOM +2.6%) outperforms after Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum predicts selling prices for 3G phones, on which Qualcomm collects royalties, will remain strong (previously), as the proliferation of 3G/4G models keeps high-end prices stable. In addition, the spread of 4G devices is lifting Qualcomm's chip prices; the 4G baseband chip found in the new iPad, for example, is believed to cost 50% more than the 3G baseband found in the iPad 2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG +3.1%) could reach $40 as it continues to shed non-core assets and begins a buyback...

    AIG (AIG +3.1%) could reach $40 as it continues to shed non-core assets and begins a buyback program that should be much bigger than investors are expecting, Deutsche Bank believes. $15B-$20B worth of buybacks over the next year is "achievable... book value per share growth in excess of 30% is possible if shares continue to hover around their current price.”

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • RUE

    Shares of Rue21(RUE +6.6%) ratchet higher after Jefferies adds a dollar to its price target to...

    Shares of Rue21(RUE +6.6%) ratchet higher after Jefferies adds a dollar to its price target to take it to $28 and issues positive comments. Despite showing positive cash flow, the stock is a favorite target of bears with 44% of its float 44% sold short.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • ANEN

    Anaren (ANEN +4.1%), a maker of RF components for wireless and aerospace/defense equipment, is...

    Anaren (ANEN +4.1%), a maker of RF components for wireless and aerospace/defense equipment, is rallying after DealReporter claims the company is receiving interest from rival API Technologies (ATNY -1.4%). It's worth noting, however, that API has a market cap of just $196M, less than Anaren's $264M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • KBH

    Bearish commentary leads KB Home (KBH -5.2%) to add to the losses seen following its FQ1 miss,...

    Bearish commentary leads KB Home (KBH -5.2%) to add to the losses seen following its FQ1 miss, which was marked by a declining gross margin and rising cancellations from buyers unable to get financing. Goldman thinks a lot of KB's problems are company-specific, noting peers have struck a more bullish tone. Wells Fargo expects bottoming residential construction to give KB a lift, but remains concerned about its weak margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • COMV

    Comverge (COMV -8%) agrees to be acquired by PE firm HIG Capital for ~$49M, or $1.75/share,...

    Comverge (COMV -8%) agrees to be acquired by PE firm HIG Capital for ~$49M, or $1.75/share, below its $1.88 Friday closing price and analyst estimates of its worth. COMV felt it had no choice, believing it "would be unable to raise the necessary capital to fund continuing operations, which would place existing stockholder investment in the company at significant risk."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • LVS

    Stifel Nicolaus hikes its price target for Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.4%) to $69 from $63 and...

    Stifel Nicolaus hikes its price target for Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.4%) to $69 from $63 and raises 2012-13 EPS estimates, believing the Cotai Central opening could be a "game changer."  The firm says the new hotel plus LVS’ existing Macau assets will account for ~52% of total Macau mass gaming capacity, "which should put LVS in a unique position relative to its peers." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +4.4%) is upgraded to Buy by UBS, which says concerns about PLCM's North American...

    Polycom (PLCM +4.4%) is upgraded to Buy by UBS, which says concerns about PLCM's North American business, which has seen customer's dial back orders, create an attractive entry point for the videoconferencing company's stock. The firm also expects PLCM to meet or beat Wall Street views, but shares are pricing in a Q1 miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL +2.7%) adds to the gains it saw in late trading on Friday on a report it had hired...

    AOL (AOL +2.7%) adds to the gains it saw in late trading on Friday on a report it had hired Evercore to sell its patent portfolio, and had also received buyout interest from P-E firms. Henry Blodget views AOL's approach to monetizing its IP, which Starboard Value believes could generate $1B in licensing revenue, as much more intelligent and PR-savvy than Yahoo's (YHOO) lawsuit-driven strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • CPN

    Calpine (CPN -2.8%) gets clipped by a Barclays downgrade to Equalweight from Overweight. After...

    Calpine (CPN -2.8%) gets clipped by a Barclays downgrade to Equalweight from Overweight. After humming right along in positive territory, shares broke sharply lower midday on the action by Barclays.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.2%) is upgraded to Buy at BofA on expectations NBC likely will renew Who...

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.2%) is upgraded to Buy at BofA on expectations NBC likely will renew Who Do You Think You Are?; even if the TV show isn't renewed, BofA thinks the provider of online family research would be able to use marketing dollars effectively elsewhere. The firm says declines in viewership have moderated and should help ACOM at least meet Q1 estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • POL

    PolyOne (POL +6.5%) is raised to Outperform from Market Perform by Wells Fargo, which also hikes...

    PolyOne (POL +6.5%) is raised to Outperform from Market Perform by Wells Fargo, which also hikes its earnings estimates for the plastic compounder and resins distributor to reflect the firm's "increased confidence in the ColorMatrix contribution and improvement in housing," and cites a more attractive valuation since shares have shed 11% in the past seven weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +6.1%) powers up to an alltime high in intraday trading on momentum...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +6.1%) powers up to an alltime high in intraday trading on momentum buying that traders are tying to the exposure that the restaurant chain receives during NCAA basketball's March Madness period and positive comments from Stephens on the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • LGF.A

    Caris upgrades Lions Gate (LGF) to "neutral" following the "stellar opening results" of the...

    Caris upgrades Lions Gate (LGF) to "neutral" following the "stellar opening results" of the "Hunger Games." While the film's success prompts Caris to improve its F2013 forecast for Lions Gate, it's not going overboard due to the company's valuation and recent insider selling. Shares are now just +2.7%, well down from premarket highs. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MU

    Chipmaker Micron (MU -2%) slips after Oppenheimer cuts the stock to Perform. The stock has...

    Chipmaker Micron (MU -2%) slips after Oppenheimer cuts the stock to Perform. The stock has jumped 30%-plus YTD, and the firm says “it was easy to set a price target of at least book value, but once that has been crossed, it becomes difficult to justify a higher valuation unless Micron becomes profitable... Investors should take profits as Micron strives for profitability."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • FL

    Shares of athletic shoe sellers Foot Locker (FL +2.8%) and Finish Line (FINL +2.4%) kick up...

    Shares of athletic shoe sellers Foot Locker (FL +2.8%) and Finish Line (FINL +2.4%) kick up gains after Longbow Research fires up upgrades on both companies to Buy from Neutral. Foot Locker gets a new price target of $38 - repping 19.5% upside potential - while Finish Line lands a $31 PT that is 23% higher than its current trading price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.2%) makes new highs after Auriga and Wunderlch issue bullish notes...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.2%) makes new highs after Auriga and Wunderlch issue bullish notes after attending a Ubiquiti-hosted conference. Both firms are impressed by the strength of Ubiquiti's customer base, and are bullish on the company's just-announced airFiber system, which can deliver 1.4 Gbps transmission speeds over the air, and thus act as a fiber substitute for many businesses and service providers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BJRI

    Shares of BJ's Restaurants (BJRI +5.9%) get a lift after Wedbush upgrades the company to...

    Shares of BJ's Restaurants (BJRI +5.9%) get a lift after Wedbush upgrades the company to Outperform from Neutral. Analysts with the firm point to momentum in same-store sales growth at the restaurant chain and set a price target of $57.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -11.2%) tumbles to new all-time lows after the cash-strapped electric car...

    A123 Systems (AONE -11.2%) tumbles to new all-time lows after the cash-strapped electric car battery maker says it's launching a recall program to replace battery modules and packs may contain defective cells. A123 estimates the program will cost $55M over the next several quarters. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Wunderlich with a $49 target price...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Wunderlich with a $49 target price raised from $30, as the firm expects ramped-up production after visiting the TSLA factory and corporate headquarters. The firm says it was clear that between what was on the floor and what was coming in from suppliers, production was at or ahead of schedule. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 24 Comments
  • SWY

    Credit Suisse reduces its rating on Safeway (SWY -2.2%) to Neutral from Outperform after finding...

    Credit Suisse reduces its rating on Safeway (SWY -2.2%) to Neutral from Outperform after finding that the grocery chain operator sits with a pension liability of a "troubling" $7B before taxes.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +2.7%) shares pop at the open after an upgrade to Buy from Hold from Jefferies, which...

    SAIC (SAI +2.7%) shares pop at the open after an upgrade to Buy from Hold from Jefferies, which cites a "new and re-energized" management team which has set "very achievable guidance"; a recently introduced dividend which addresses concerns about SAI's capital deployment strategy; and attractive valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • TVIX

    "TVIX only $6.50 above fair value," tweets a wise guy as shares in the leveraged ETN are...

    "TVIX only $6.50 above fair value," tweets a wise guy as shares in the leveraged ETN are hammered again this morning, -8.4% to $6.56, bringing the decline to 55% in less than 3 days. ETN prices can vary widely from NAV, leading to excessively high premiums when shares become dear, and then the correction when the issuer prints up more.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 6 Comments
  • AUDC

    Shares of AudioCodes (NASDAQ:AUDC) come off of a trading halt down 9.7% premarket after the firm...

    Shares of AudioCodes (NASDAQ:AUDC) come off of a trading halt down 9.7% premarket after the firm cuts its sales outlook for Q1 and FY12 sharply lower due to weak North America sales and lower than expected government orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • CXDC

    China XD Plastics (NASDAQ:CXDC) +7.9% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.40 and...

    China XD Plastics (NASDAQ:CXDC) +7.9% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.40 and revenue of $113.9M, easily beating analyst expectations. CXDC sees FY 2012 non-GAAP adjusted net income of $82M-$85M and revenue of $550M-$580M vs. consensus revenue of $453.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures build on early gains on the merest whiff of more possible QE from...

    Market preview: U.S. futures build on early gains on the merest whiff of more possible QE from Ben Bernanke, although the dollar takes a fall. Lions Gate (+3.6%) gives back some of its gains made following the roaring box office success of the "Hunger Games." Later: Pending Home Sales, Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) provides updated estimates for Q1 and full-year production guidance....

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) provides updated estimates for Q1 and full-year production guidance. The coal producer expects to see production in a range of 2.8M-2.9M metric for the current quarter and reaffirms 11.5M-13M output for full-year 2012. The company says that in order to support margins it will decrease production from a coal mine in West Virginia by approximately 35% starting in Q2. Shares +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) +3.4% premarket on acceptance of a marketing authorization application for...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) +3.4% premarket on acceptance of a marketing authorization application for its avanafil investigational drug for treatment of erectile dysfunction by the European Medicines Agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • ARNA

    Premarket gainers: ARNA +9%. LGF +4%. AEZS +4%. GALE +4%. VVUS +3%. OTC:KITD +3%. RF +3%. NG...

    Premarket gainers: ARNA +9%. LGF +4%. AEZS +4%. GALE +4%. VVUS +3%. OTC:KITD +3%. RF +3%. NG +3%. WFT +3%.
    Losers: IBN -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) +8.7% premarket after announcing its weight-loss drug...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) +8.7% premarket after announcing its weight-loss drug candidate lorcaserin was accepted for review by European regulators and confirming that an FDA advisory committee will meet during Q2 to discuss ARNA’s resubmitted application for lorcaserin.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • LXK

    Shares of Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) move 0.9% lower premarket after the company takes on a downgrade...

    Shares of Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) move 0.9% lower premarket after the company takes on a downgrade from Bernstein to Market Perform from Outperform on a dour outlook for revenue. Analysts with the firm also trim their price target on LXK to $38 from $46.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • VRNM

    Verenium (NASDAQ:VRNM) announces that it sold a number of assets and licenses to Dutch firm...

    Verenium (NASDAQ:VRNM) announces that it sold a number of assets and licenses to Dutch firm Royal DSM for $37M. The company says that following the deal its focus will remain on developing enzymes in the areas of animal health and nutrition, grain processing and oilfield services. Shares +29.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • OVRL

    Overland Storage (NASDAQ:OVRL) +5% premarket after announcing that its SnapServer DX Series of...

    Overland Storage (NASDAQ:OVRL) +5% premarket after announcing that its SnapServer DX Series of products won the Hardware Product of the Year award at the 2012 Network Computing awards.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • TLM

    Shares of Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) gain 2.5% in premarket trading after the firm announces a...

    Shares of Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) gain 2.5% in premarket trading after the firm announces a successful test for light oil from a well in the Kurdistan region of northern Iraq.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF) +7.2% after "The Hunger Games" earns $214.3M worldwide at the weekend, with the...

    Lions Gate (LGF) +7.2% after "The Hunger Games" earns $214.3M worldwide at the weekend, with the $155M from U.S. and Canadian cinemas making it the largest "domestic" opening for a movie that isn't a sequel. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM

  • "It doesn’t take much to recreate risks of contagion," says Italian PM Mario Monti,...

    "It doesn’t take much to recreate risks of contagion," says Italian PM Mario Monti, calling out Spain as a country that could reignite the eurozone debt crisis. Spanish shares are also under pressure following a weekend regional election in which the ruling People's Party failed to obtain an absolute majority. Spain's IBEX 35 -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 AM | 2 Comments
